@markdroth Technically, we only need fake_security_connector and ssl_security_connector. There is nothing shared between fake and ssl. E.g., the DefaultSslRootStore or tsi_peer_get_property_by_name are only relevant to ssl. The reason we put these in a common place is because in the near future we will have 3 ssl related security connectors (ssl_security_connector, spiffe_tls_security_connector, https_tls_security_connector) have some shared common functions.

To be clear, I am not objecting to having some shared code between the three SSL-related security connector implementations.  All I am saying is that that shared code should go in its own library, rather than being in the security_connector.{h,cc} module itself.  That module should contain only the abstract security_connector interface, not code that is required only for a subset of security_connector implementations.

Thanks Jiangtao and Mark for the review. 

The following changes are made. PTAL.

1) `security_connector.{h, cc}` now only contains security connector related API's. 
2) `ssl_session_cache.cc` is created to contain the implementation of ssl session cache. 
3) `default_ssl_root_store.{h, cc}` is created to store the implementation of SSL default root store.
4) `security_connector_util.{h, cc}` is created to store other common functions that will be shared by different security connector implementations.
